BUDAPEST Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban congratulated U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump on his election victory on Wednesday
column2: with the words ""What a great news. Democracy is still alive"" posted on his Facebook page.Orban said in July that Trump's plans on migration and foreign policy were ""vital"" for Hungary
column3: whereas those of rival Democrat Hillary Clinton were ""deadly"".Orban was then the first European head of state to express a clear preference for either of the two candidates.

column1: Orban has in the past upset fellow members of the European Union over policy
column2: most recently with his tough stance on Europe's migrant crisis
column3: objecting to EU resettlement plans and having a fence built along Hungary's southern border.
